snippet: The plant, at the Hanford Nuclear Reservation in Washington State, has problems that could lead to chemical explosions or other breakdowns, a panel said.
abstract: Federal advisory panel finds hazardous design problems in treatment plant that Energy Department is counting on to stabilize radioactive waste at Hanford Nuclear Reservation in Washington State, site of nation's largest environmental cleanup project; finding is latest in plant's expensive and troubled history.
lead_paragraph: The plant, at the Hanford Nuclear Reservation in Washington State, has problems that could lead to chemical explosions or other breakdowns, a panel said.

headline.main: Treatment Plant for Waste in Nuclear Cleanup Has Design Flaws, Panel Says
headline.print_headline: Treatment Plant for Waste in Nuclear Cleanup Has Design Flaws, Panel Says
